definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
to be honest and upright/to have moral integrity

sentences.english: I think any decent person would say that.
sentences.chinese: 我想所有正派的人都会这样回答。

sentences.english: No respectable citizen in town had anything to do with Mad Henry
sentences.chinese: 市镇里没有哪个正派人与其有任何来往。

sentences.english: And those who dared to gainsay the wisdom of the fathers were shunned by all decent people.
sentences.chinese: 谁否定先人的智慧，谁就会遭到正派人的冷落。

sentences.english: You thought we could be decent men in an indecent world.
sentences.chinese: 你以为我们可以在这猥琐的世界上做正派人。

sentences.english: All of these sayings reflect the American obsession with properness and efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些格言都反映了美国人对正派和效率的痴迷。

sentences.english: The police are keeping / standing guard over the house.
sentences.chinese: 警察正派人守护着这幢房子。

sentences.english: He hopes that his son will be a good citizen in the future. (morally right)
sentences.chinese: 他希望他的儿子今后做一个正派人。

sentences.english: He threw in with some crooked men.
sentences.chinese: 他和几个不正派的人混在一起。

sentences.english: He's connected to all the right people.
sentences.chinese: 与他有关系的人都是正派人。

sentences.english: Twain is fierce enough with crooked congressmen .
sentences.chinese: 马克吐温对于不正派的国会议员攻击甚力。

sentences.english: Three, this center request a client function virtuous, the attitude is honest.
sentences.chinese: 本中心要求委托人作风正派，态度诚实。

sentences.english: Many old people find the bikini immodest.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人感到穿比基尼式游泳服不正派。
我说他为人正派且风度翩翩。

sentences.english: Several witnesses can attest to her good character.
sentences.chinese: 好几个证人可以证明他为人正派。

definition: open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
to hate evil as one hates an enemy (idiom)
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
